prism

Class PrismLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GUIVisualLogModel, GUIWindowLog, PrismDevNullLog, PrismFileLog, PrismPrintStreamLog

    public abstract class PrismLog
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int numberOfWarnings
      Keeps the count of warnings printed so far.
      protected int verbosityLevel 
      static int VL_ALL
      Specifies that all messages should be printed
      static int VL_DEFAULT
      Specifies that only more important messages should be printed
      static int VL_HIGH
      Specifies that the output should be more verbose

    • Method Detail

      • resetNumberOfWarnings

        public void resetNumberOfWarnings()
        Sets the counter of warnings printed to 0.

      • getNumberOfWarnings

        public int getNumberOfWarnings()
        Returns the number of warnings that have been printed since the beginning or since the last reset of the number of warnings.

      • getVerbosityLevel

        public int getVerbosityLevel()
        Returns the verbosity level of this log. The verbosity level determines what messages will be printed.
        Returns:

      • setVerbosityLevel

        public void setVerbosityLevel(int verbosityLevel)
        Changes the verbosity level of this log. The verbosity level determines what messages will be printed.
        Parameters:
        verbosityLevel - Should be one of VL_DEFAULT, VL_HIGH or VL_ALL.

      • printWarning

        public void printWarning(java.lang.String s)
        Prints a warning message s, preceded by "\nWarning: " and followed by a newline character.
        Also increases numberOfWarnings by one. This variable can then be queried using getNumberOfWarnings() at the end of computation and the user can be appropriately informed that there were warnings generated.
        Parameters:
        s - The warning message.
